name: Chris Angel
text: I normally give others the benefit of the doubt and not so quick to place a bad review but I looked at another review and saw that someone had a similar experience to mine. I planned on going out if town on the 4th of July weekend and was happy to speak with the owner who confirmed she would be at the kennel at 8 a.m the next morning. I got there at 745 and called  only to meet the place locked up and the phone on busy so that calls didn't go through. It was so frustrating as I didn't not planned on taking my 120lb dog on a 6 hour drive but had to due to no response. This lady has a nice space in back for animals but this is not a serious business for her so she is not passionate about providing great service because she probably doesn't really care. Good luck getting a hold of her when you need to. Wish she had simply called and let me know something but absolutely no contact was made and no apology for the inconvenience. What a waste of time and gas.

name: Noah Gill
text: Love Mrs. Chaney. Went to pick up my dog this afternoon and no answer at the house or Kennel. Everything locked up and phone gave busy signal. Not sure what to do at this point. 😕 definitely disappointed with the situation.

name: Rachelle Griffin
text: The lady that runs and owns it is so sweet and helpful my dog had never been kenneled before and he liked this place She has nice kennels a beautiful property and she is cheap... I will be going back ...

name: Don Shelman
text: We've used them for years and my dogs love it!

name: robert garrison
text: We took our dog there a couple of times and after the second trip she really didn't want to go in there like something was wrong. Won't go back.

name: Cami Jennings
text: Took my two pups here today. They went in for their temperament test for daycare, and I tried to warn them that one of my dogs gets overwhelmed easily on leash. They barely greeted me, and took them without asking any questions and threw them into a fully packed yard without reading their charts. My pup must've gotten too overwhelmed and she started to get protective. The main man at the daycare came out and yelled at me, pointing his finger in my face, and saying rude and abrupt things. I doubt this would've happened to others, but he seemed to think he could get away with it because I'm a young 20 year old girl. Would not recommend this place. I thought that they would at least try to work with my dogs because that's their job but they didn't. Treat your customers with respect.

name: hillary lemley
text: Horrible. Horrible service also. My dog stayed with them for 4 days and came home with BLOODY feet and they didn’t even tell me. I had to call back the next morning. I spoke with the owner and she basically blamed my dog, saying she couldn’t sit still. I’m sorry, but she plays at home constantly, and has never came home with slashed paws! I had to take her to the vet the next day and now she’s on several medications to help her heal. AWFUL. Do not take your pets here!!

name: Paul Brasfield
text: Such a nice facility where the owners and the staff genuinely care for your pet.

name: Brittany Ball
text: HH is the best of the best! My shy German Shepherd loves it here. I will never take her anywhere else.

name: Melissa french
text: Excellent facility. Our dog absolutely loves it. The owners and staff are great and very attentive.

name: Susannah Lamon
text: Love this place! The staff is friendly, and the grounds are so nice!! I've taken my pup to quite a few places in Birmingham and this is by far the kennel we feel the most comfortable and she seems the happiest staying. I can tell she plays all day because she comes home just absolutely exhausted. Great place!!

name: Stephanie Baj
text: We love HH Farm! Would not trust anyone else with our girl.

name: Stephanie Casterline
text: We have used Howlin Hollows multiple times for our two dogs when we have gone on trips. The facility is immaculate, clean and beautiful.   The large indoor kennels are amazing with glass doors that the staff write special notes on about our dogs. (If they have a special treat etc)   There are several different areas the dogs can run and play set in beautiful shaded woods and hills. They have a doggy swimming pool that is ionized and a water feature water fall.  It truly is a vacation for our  pups!  Its so comforting to know our dogs are being so well taken care of when we travel!

name: Amanda B
text: Been taking our doodle since she was 6mos old. Everytime we pull up, she squeals with joy! Always worn out when we pick her up too (hooray!). We tried other places too and while perfectly fine for socializing,  after she was full grown, their "runs" just didn't accommodate her activity level needs. Howlin Hollows offer plenty of room to run (or relax!). Great staff, too.

name: Becca Fulmer
text: We searched around the greater Birmingham area for approximately 3 months before we found a place that we were comfortable leaving our pup with. Whereas other kennels and boarding places keep your pet in cages for a large part of the day and rotate them out during the day to play, Howlin Hollows has multiple, large fenced in outdoor areas for your dog to play in all day. All day!! They also have a zero entry pool for your pup to jump in and cool off. The actual kennel facilities are amazing. No cages. You really should at least tour this place before making a decision about whether it is right for your pet or not. It is especially great for high-energy dogs, and dogs that either really enjoy playing with other dogs or that you would like to socialize more. Our pup started off very timid and is slowly becoming much less shy around other dogs. Feel free to contact me personally- i'm happy to share more about my experience with this place.

name: Chuck Schroeder
text: This is like having my dogs at my own house but they get to play and swim in the pool ALL day with other dogs. They get to socialize constantly which in my experience ( 5 dogs) is what most dogs are lacking today. They come home with such a passive demeanor, kids do not have to worry about an aggressive dog and when you walk your dog they would try to play with a passerby dog, not try to pick a fight. Its the owners fault the dog is aggressive- LACK OF DOG SOCIALIZATION!!! Give them a try, you will be thrilled, but your dogs will love it more!!

name: Cynthia Wingard
text: In 30 plus years of marriage  my husband and I have never boarded our dogs when we go out of town always asking family members to care for them or getting a pet sitter. We heard about Howlin Hollows Dog Farm , toured the facility and started trying out the Day Care for our 3 dogs. We were so impressed we've already boarded them twice and couldn't be happier with the care and attention they received!! Kimi and Scott obviously love dogs and take care of their "guests" like they were their family.  I am so happy we can now take our dogs to Howlin Hollows Dog Farm when we travel and have complete peace of mind about the care of our 4-legged children!!!

name: Carlos Enrique Aleman
text: The best place for our Lulu.

name: Betsy Reamer
text: Our favorite place in town - whether for a play day or for boarding, we trust Sadie is having the best time and is very well taken care of. When we pull up, she knows where she is and can't get out of the car fast enough! We love everything and everyone at Howlin Hollows!

name: Heather
text: This is the BEST daycare / boarding facility in the state! The owners are huge dog lovers and all-around good people. The in-ground dog pool is amazing! Your dog will love Howlin Hollows! A++

name: Josh Champion
text: This place is phenomenal and takes great care of our dog!

name: Betsy Reamer
text: We've absolutely loved this place since the first time we took our 12 week old puppy to board her. We've never experienced anything less than the highest level of service and care for our sweet pup. We feel like we're doing her a disservice if we don't take her out there at least once a week because she loves it so much! She gets to run around and swim, and she loves the owners like they're her second parents. Don't discount this place because of 1 review where there are 2 sides to every story and people who have reviewed without ever stepping onto the property. We've been fans of Howlin Hollows from the start and not one thing has made us waiver from our initial feeling. Thankful to have them as a part of the community and as a weekly resource!

name: Jason Lovoy
text: Love this place. You have to see it to believe it. I now recommend to all my friends when asked where in Birmingham to board their dog(s). Whether you have a big dog or little dog - there is a place for them (we have a little dog - but you never have to worry about them getting plowed over by the bigger faster dogs as they have separate places to run.)

name: Ryan Ramage
text: Great place for our dog and not a prettier place around.  Our 13 year old lab loves lounging around the pool and playing in the numerous yards.  Owners a true dog lovers!!

name: Jordan McDonough
text: My dogs love coming here. We always get them back happy and exhausted from all their play. Wonder facility that really cares about dogs!

name: nate Allen
text: EASILY the most beautiful pet care place I've ever seen. I mean off-the-charts nice. Hell, I wish I could stay there. Seriously, it's that beautiful.

name: Jackson Tate
text: Unbelievable place!!! I not only wanted to drop my dog off there, but I wanted to stay there myself for the weekend! Absolutely spectacular establishment and wonderful staff!

name: Mike Schmidt
text: Seemed like a good place. Left the dog for a week. Supposed to get a bath last day. On pickup they said he chased another dog - he does NOT start fights with dogs.  No bath. Said he showed his teeth. He gets regular baths at Petco and others who board him with never an issue.  Add it up, someone likely mistreated him. Would reccomend somewhere else, especially for 40.00 a day and you supply food. Head to take dog to vet.  Has injuries around his eye.

name: Don Gaston
text: I have been using Howlin Hollows Farm since March of this year for my dog's boarding and day care and the results have been exceptional. My wife and I have been looking for a place like this for years where your dog can run and just be a dog. Rosie, my brittany, is a high energy dog that needs plenty of exercise which she can get at Howlin Hollows. Scott, Kimi, and the entire staff go out of their way to make sure your dog has a pleasing experience. The facility is first class and always extremely clean. Birmingham has needed a place like this for your pet for a long time.

name: Shannon Hughes
text:
Howlin Hounds is a lifesaver for me!!  Lokie stayed there a week while I went on vacation and he had a better time than I did!! Lol. They have acres of fenced yard for him to run plus a swimming pool that he loves!!
He goes to doggie daycare a few days a week. The facility is clean and the staff is amazing!!! Thanks guys!!

text: Super Friendly staff. Fast service. Very good with your pets and will exceed beyond your pets needs.

name: Kacee Mashburn
text: I chose to board my dog here because he had to be in rabies quarantine for 5 days and needed his vaccinations. The fourth morning he was there was a Sunday and somehow he managed to escape. At first, they told me he had chewed through a metal door AND a chain link fence. That sounded very unlikely. They told me they were looking and had the police and animal control looking too. My family looked for four hours that morning with no sight of the police or animal control looking. When I called on Monday to get an explanation on what happened, they wouldn’t give me information over the phone because I wasn’t the “owner” on paper. It was in my moms name. This was after I paid for the bill and brought him to the vet myself. I had to go up there with my mother to get my refund and a proper explanation. They only gave me a partial refund and no one came to talk to us until I asked for camera footage. The manager was somewhat sincere and I learned that he in fact did not chew through any metal or fence. He chewed through a wooden door and managed to bend the chain link fence to crawl up under it. I got a clear explanation and some of my money back, but have yet to find my dog. They told me they were still looking but I have no way of knowing that. We’ve been searching for a week now and no sightings of him. I was under the impression that he was going to be watched 24/7 since he had never been boarded before but I was wrong. Just a thought before you choose to board your pet here or use this place for any of your needs. Also there is one secretary up front who is very very rude and seems to be emotionless.

name: Nicole Woods
text: I will forever be grateful to Dr Tucker and his staff. After visiting 2 other vets we had no answers for our sick baby Bruno, and knew he was only getting worse throughout the day. After a friend recommended Dr Tucker I called and explained my baby being sick and my worries I was asked to immediately bring Bruno in. Dr Tucker identified why our baby was so sick in minutes and was honest about what was best for Bruno. Unfortunately Bruno was put to rest 07/17/2018 which was such a hard decision to make, but Dr Tucker and his staff helped us through this heart breaking circumstance. Dr Tucker explained each step of putting Bruno to sleep and truly respected the bond we had with Bruno. Before leaving we were given a plaque with our baby Bruno’s paw print and his name. This was a gift from Dr Tucker. Thank you all at B&A Hospital I am forever grateful.

Because she has always treated me this way, I have taken my business else where. I'm sure the vet is nice, but, I unfortunately never made it past the rudeness at the front desk. If you are going to work with the public, at least TRY not to be so rude!

name: Todd Champion
text: Great vet and they are able to get us in quickly.

name: Dakota Craft
text: I took my German Shepherd here for problems with eating, energy, and vomiting. My usual vet was closed and I was in desperate need so I tried the place. I was told she had parvo and that my only options were to either pay just under $500 and take her home with medicine or just under $800 and they would put her on an IV. I chose the less expensive option took her home and started to treat her when it occurred to me her temperature was not even taken. They listened to the symptoms, performed a parvo test, walked in the back and returned with a “barely readable positive” theory explaining no matter what I spent she would very likely die. They claimed to have diagnosed 6 animals prior to me with parvo and stated that it had been airborne for the last few weeks in the area (at the time I was so tore up I did not even understand that parvo doesn’t simply “blow up in my yard from neighbors down the road”) Upon considering my options I then took her to another vet and told them what happened. They did a quick exam and came back with “no you were lied to, your dog has contracted a form of worms that ordinary wormer will not treat. She is not even close to positive on the parvo test, has no temperature, and is only showing 2 signs of it which is also symptoms of several other possible problems.” This vet is absolutely terrible, rude, and greedy. I can not imagine what kind of idiot would consider these people as qualified.

name: Frantina Wilson
text: I have to say I had heard negative things about Piper's from friends, but I continued to use them because we had always had good experiences with them. However, I really can't give Piper's a good review after my 4 babies latest visit over Thanksgiving weekend. We took more than enough of everything that our 2 dogs and 2 cats would need for a stay that spanned from Wednesday night - Sunday night. When we picked them up and got home we noticed left over food for the dogs, we took separate bags for each dog for each day, so was there a day that the dogs were not fed. In addition, MOST of the food we took for the cats was still in the bag...that concerns me as well. My 18 month old cat came home extremely jittery and has been jumping at the slightest noise. I can't say that Piper's did anything wrong, but I will say that our furbies did not come home happy this time. The cats will probably never go back and I will have to think long and hard about taking the dogs back too. The staff, as always, was great in their interactions with me.

name: Erin Calvert
text:
This local Dog establishment is violating multiple heath codes. The owner of this facility and the manager were told on multiple occasions by employees and were aware of the following: Fire extinguishers (they only have 2) being extremely out of date, last checked back in 2015— also no evacuation plan, or safety drills, air vent maintenance doesn’t take place— vents/filters not properly maintained can easily catch fire, this company works with LIVE animals, the safety of your dogs are not being considered as you can tell from the images.... everything is layered with years of dog dander and hair.
When the heater gets turned on the smell of burning hair lasts for days and the company uses wax melts up front to mask the smells. They also stuff the vents they don’t clean with smell good beads to mask the smell.
Even daycare dogs are kenneled. Employees hang around upfront until around 9 when they decide to start putting dogs in daycare—- this means if you’re paying for a full day or even a half day of doggie daycare starting in the morning your furbabies are missing out on 2+ hours of socialization. This facility doesn’t properly clean the daycare room. And weeks worth of hair is noticeable near the drains in the daycare play areas, this is extremely unsafe for your animals/the employees. The smell in this building that’s separate from the building your drop off your dog is horrific. Dogs are left unsupervised in daycare, and the daycare supervision in maintained outside of the daycare rooms- so instead of dogs getting that one-on-one attention they are only monitored when barking has increased. Because of that, rooms aren’t cleaned right away causing burns on paw pads from dogs playing around in urine. Most dogs have to be ran through Grooming to be spot cleaned before leaving. Bored dogs have started eating the walls of this establishment because of the lack of social interaction they receive. This facility illegally mentioned to employees that they can not pay overtime to them when they have worked 40+ hrs. Because of this, I believe the care of the animals that go there are being affected.
During the recent snow storm an employee managed to chase a already nervous dog around the front lobby of this establishment causing him to run out of the front door. This dog was missing for a week and found with his hip shattered, and he had ate an entire toe off of himself.. this establishment paid his vet bill which included the cost of utilization. Clearly the proper training of employees is not being conducted. This facility also does not clean kennels often and when they do they use a dirty mop to wipe out the kennels. This is probably a factor to the outbreak of kennel cough they are currently battling.
Many times employees just feed  dogs breakfast without even bothering to clean the kennel first or move the dog to a clean kennel.. that means that they were eating breakfast in their own filth and kenneled with it until daycare started up. In It’s hard enough trusting someone, let along finding out an establishment you’re paying LOTS of money to is neglecting your animal. This establishment recently caused the death of a small 4 lb dog, and they are trying to cover it up. By deleting comments and blocking any negativity they receive. I refuse to be silent. This facility is anything but transparent!!!

name: Kate Upchurch
text: Prior to this past visit I'd have written a great review but when I picked my little guy  ( a shih tzu )up on Christmas Eve I was horrified! Shaking, limping and handed dirty bedding with no explanation as to how he was injured, why we weren't informed  when it happened plus finding out he'd been very stressed by being kenneled every night in the large room with the large dogs with big dog barks! When I first boarded @ Piper's 2 years ago I requested that he be kenneled at night with only little dogs and was shown a room off the hall on the right where I was told the small dogs stayed. When I asked why he was put in the big room this time with the big dogs she said "well, you didn't request that he be separated". If my file had been consulted I'm sure it would reflect my wishes. There was no I'm sorry we didn't contact you about his injury, etc. He literally had to be carried that night and Christmas day every time to potty, to food bowl, etc. While I understand this may not be the norm @ Piper's, ( had never happened to me before) since it happened this time, I'll be making other arrangements next time. Beware. Things are not always as they seem. Ask to see where your dog will be put at night. I was told they  NEVER allow tours! That's shocking! I've ALWAYS toured where I board my dog. Ask what their policy is if your dog becomes injured or sick. I asked when the owner would be there as I wanted to speak in person with them and was told the owner was never at the Anniston location. Really? So, I've emailed the owner to express my concerns.

name: Douglas Beckham
text:
My wife and I are new to the high powered world of the  “working breed” of German Shepherds.  We recently purchased one, Ramos, from  Germany.  After about  6 weeks here,  he developed a case of bloat that could have killed him.  With bloat, the stomach actually "flips over" and cuts the blood supply off to the stomach, causing a rapid distension, and death if not treated quickly.  Fortunately, Ramos' stomach flipped back without emergency surgery.

Not wanting to go through this again, we researched bloat and found the best “cure” for it is a laparoscopic assisted gastropexy.  In this procedure the dog's stomach is sutured to the abdominal wall. The sutures eventually dissolve but the stomach is held permanently in place by an "adhesion" preventing recurrent "flipping".  Many animal hospitals do not have a laparoscope or the skill to accomplish this procedure.  Dr. Daniels was able to take care of this surgery and Ramos is 99% normal after five days. He has personally checked on Ramos 4 times on his own time since surgery.

Everything about Drs. Daniels and Clark, and their clinic and team  was strictly professional, yet courteous and friendly.  We can't forget Cassidy, the glue and the center of their clinic.  Exceptional personality and warmth!

If you are looking for a superior team to take care of your special “family member”, consider Dr. Daniels and Clark at Nall Daniels Animal Hospital in Homewood.

Not close enough for you? As Joe Biden would say, "Come on man!!"
This is not about closeness!!
It’s about quality !!!!!!!!!

Douglas Beckham, D.M.D.

name: Emma Pacey
text:
When I adopted my dog, the one thing the previous owner recommended is for us to take him to this office since he had been bringing him here his whole life and they "knew him really well". The first time I took him for his annual shots and a check up I asked about the small lumps on his body and they said it was nothing. 6 months ago I took him to this office to get a check up because we had some concerns. After paying hundreds of dollars for tests and x-rays, they assured me that there was nothing usual going on with my dog. This week he started getting very sick, and after a trip to a different vet, we found out he had cancer and it was very prolonged and caused other problems like anemia, kidney failure and lesions on his lungs. This kind of progression doesn't happen in 6 months. It happens over years. He had been coming here for years and they never once said anything about the cancer that was all over my dog's body and covering his organs. At this point, he was in too much pain, couldn't eat or drink, and could hardly breathe. The new vet and I decided it was best to put him down so he wouldn't be hurting anymore. After years of coming to the same office they never said anything remotely close to cancer.

There is nothing I can do for my dog anymore, but there is still something you can do for your's. DO NOT bring your animals to this office. There is no way a cancer this severe goes unnoticed for so long with an office that provides quality care. Find somewhere to take your pets that won't treat them like they treated my dog. I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

name: Quentin Collins
text: Always super friendly staff! Prices are comparable. Dr. Clark is awesome! Highly recommended.

name: Della Clark
text: Amazing staff. Only place I'd go.

name: Ryan Halcomb
text: My dog was referred here by my primary vet for a laparoscopic liver biopsy. The staff at Nall-Daniels was outstanding. They kept me updated on every step of the process and laid out a clear plan for the next steps. I was nervous at first taking my pet for a surgery at a place I have never been, but as soon as I started talking to the staff I knew my dog was in good hands. I would definitely recommend this place!

name: Lizzy Dee
text: They were so attentive and helpful. I got my cat groomed and a collar for her to wear when given medicine and they have kept up with us.

name: Jody Poe
text: Nall Daniels Animal Hospital is great! My little dog "Molly" was so well cared for there right up until the very end. She had to be euthanized on December 22nd, and everyone at Nall Daniels was so sweet through all of this. After Molly died, I got the sweetest cards from Dr. Daniels and Dr. Dunaway as well as from other staff. They even had a beautiful plant delivered to my home in memory of Molly. Molly always got excellent medical care at Nall Daniels, and they will definitely be my vets for my new little rescue dog that I adopted. I highly recommend Nall Daniels Animal Hospital.

name: Rocky Redding
text: They are awesome people! I have been taking my Pookie dog there for about three years.

name: Leigh Misso
text: Last week my little 10lb Dachshund was bit by  a copper head twice in our yard and Nall Daniels was WONDERFUL. They immediately took him back, got an IV started to counteract the effects of the venom, and monitored him very closely. Thru lots of prayer and the amazing Veterinarians at Nall Daniels, Gus was completely healed in 24 hours!  I would recommend everyone take their pets to them!

name: wendy roberts
text: I rated this place 5 stars at first. They did surgery on my daughter's dog. He ended up dead. They kept telling her he was OK over the phone. She called THREE times. They had 3 chances to say bring him in.

name: Tom Atkins
text:
In the year or so I’ve used Nall-Daniels I found them to be competent veterinarians, but based on exam costs I had begun to wonder if their prices were high.

So when it was time to have my pug spayed, I decided to get quotes from two of the highest rated vets in Homewood. The prices I was quoted by them were very close to each other... $250 and $260.  I then called Nall-Daniels for a quote. I was very surprised to hear an amazing price of $823. When they heard me gasp over the phone they quickly added that this was a worse case estimate.  I quickly thanked them for the estimate and moved my vet account for my 3 dogs to one of the two highly rated vets that gave me more reasonable estimates.

I wondered later what was included in a worst case scenario! A Heart transplant?

name: Nicole Harris
text: The staff was very nice and professional they gladly answered every little question i had

name: Kirk Atkinson
text: I've had four dogs cared for at Nall Daniels - they do an amazing job. Very friendly and knowledgeable techs, the vets keep our dogs in peak health and boarding is very convenient and economical.

name: Corin Thompson
text:
Nall Daniels has always been good to us. I've always been wary of local vets because they all have terrible reviews and it makes a lot of places look sketch. They have been willing and able to give us quotes for treatments so that we can make the best decisions for our cats based on our income.

Our cat Bubbles was diagnosed with bone cancer. The vet did everything she could to get the right diagnosis and give us as many options as available. They could not treat her there but she offered info for treatment elsewhere. We really felt that everything had been done that could be done. I definitely recommend this place 100%

name: Lorraine Donald
text: The dog referred to by Ms. Phillips was a dog that was given up to Adopt A Golden Birmingham with a sense of urgency.   Upon arrival to the clinic the dog had to be carried in and was recumbent the whole time and clearly in medical distress.   The blood panel showed that the dog was in end stage renal failure and to complicate matters was Heart Worm positive.  The medical team at Nall Daniels immediately relayed to Adopt A Golden Bham their findings and indicated that the dog was indeed suffering.  It was their medical opinion that the dog should be euthanized.  Neither Adopt A Golden Birmingham nor Nall Daniels Animal Hospital medical team take these decisions lightly.   We are in the business of rescuing and saving dogs.  Not making this decision and watching the dog suffer was simply not an option, as much as it devastates all of us involved to terminate the life of any of our dogs.   We have the utmost respect for Dr. Daniels and his medical team and are proud to be associated with their clinic and the "above the call of duty care" they give to all the rescue dogs that they have treated for us and will continue to treat.   We are all saddened by this.  Lorraine Donald Founder, Adopt A Golden Birmingham

name: Andy West
text: Nall Daniels has the most knowledgeable staff that we have seen in Birmingham. They are also the most caring group of people you will find and will put the needs of your pet first.

name: April L. Butler
text: Great service and techs that seem passionate about the animals, our pup seemed happy to go and not anxious when we picked up, as she has at other facilities.  Although they are a bit pricier than others, it is worth it for piece of mind.

name: Erin Laney
text: Wonderful Dr and staff all the way around!

name: Susan mcgriff
text: The girls in front are so sweet.. I use Dr Daniels is a very good person,surgeon..

name: Jean Lindquist
text: The service I received at Nall-Daniel Pet Hospital far exceeded my expectations! Nall-Daniel’s provides a variety of veterinary services including well pet check ups, grooming, surgery, and prescriptions. We went there for our yearly check up and vaccinations for our two dogs; a senior Golden Retriever, and a six year old mutt. The entrance was very clean and clam. When we got called back, we were in a decent sized examination room with a vet tech, I can’t remember his name, but he was a very kind and patient young man with brown hair. He was very thorough with us; he listened to and answered all of our questions. He even provided us with a printed out quote of what all the shots, the visit, and the treatment for the ear infection that our Golden had, before performing any procedures. Then, Dr. Dunaway came in to examine them. She immediately got down in the floor and started loving on the boys. You could see her passion for animal care when she came in the room. She was very articulate and detail oriented, laying out all of the treatment options for the ear infection and recommending medication for his arthritis, too. Her bedside manner was impeccable and I felt listened to and informed as she explained everything that she was doing. We never felt rushed, even as it got near closing time. All in all, it was a wonderful experience. I had called fifteen clinic before choosing this one. The reason I chose them in the first place was because they were one of the most affordable. Sometimes, affordability comes at the expense of the quality of care, but not here. I could tell they genuinely cared about the well being of our animals, and I think that we have found a lifelong vet! I can not recommend them enough!

name: Shocklemzoa
text: My little doggie got scratched in her eye by one of our cats. When I got home her eye was puffy and irritated. I immediately too her to Nall Daniels Animal Hospital. There was a major down pour of rain as I pulled in. As I walked in I was warmly greeted and told them what happened. Within a couple of minutes they were looking at my dogs eye and found a little scratch. They gave her some medicine for pain and put some other medicine in there to make sure there wouldn't be an infection. I could see my little precious was already starting to feel better. This is a wonderful place to take your pets. They treated my little doggie like she was one of their own. They even wiped her down with towels to get the rain off as she was shivering a little. Great service. Highly recommended. Thanks NDAH!

name: Keri Cartee
text:
Last week I had to make the difficult decision to put my sweet dog of 15 years to sleep.  I had recently made Nall Daniels my vet and had only needed to bring my dog in a few times before she died.  Although the prices are not low (comparable to other vets, but all are high these days it seems!) the care she received was excellent, the staff was very friendly, and every time I brought her in I received calls to check on her in a day or two.  When I brought her in a week ago, I knew it was probably going to be time to put her down.  She was suffering and could no longer walk.  The staff at Nalls Daniel couldn't have been more kind, caring, gentle, thoughtful, and patient with me and my family.  They made the process as personal and easy as it could be made.  They took good care of my dog and of me until the end.  They were respectful of me and my wishes during this heartbreaking time.
Today I returned from a luncheon to find beautiful flowers waiting on my porch in memory of Mini from the staff at Nalls Daniel.  I am overwhelmed at their kindness.  Thank you, Nalls Daniel, for caring for my sweet furry friend... and for caring for my heart today as I've been missing her so much.  <3

name: Alex Pearlstein
text: Awesome vet. Highly recommended.

name: Robert
text: Wonderful general vetinary

name: Katy Williams
text: Top notch professionals who care about the pets that they treat!

name: Anita Gann
text: Very caring. That are wonderful with my gut babies!!!

name: Erica Phillips
text: Euthanasia is their specialty! They did so without my consent.  They gave up on my dog within a few hours ( never take your dog to this clinic) for something as simple as puppy vaccinations they may be okay doing so. #sadistic

name: Paul Cipollone
text: Great care

name: Robert Levy
text: Best vets and most caring

name: Alan Spain
text: Great friendly staff

name: M Smith
text: My dog seemed to have a great time at doggy day care. He was happy and tired when I picked him up. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and kind. The facility appears clean.

name: Matthew Mayo
text: We take our dog rascal here for grooming and daycare regularly. He’s always so happy and excited to go, and comes home tired out at the end of the day, which is quite a feat for a jack russell. The groomer always does a great job with him, and he looks (and more importantly smells) like a million bucks after. I’ve recommended JHH to all of my friends.

name: Wendy Montealegre
text:
I LOVE Just Happy Hounds.  First, the facilty is spotless.  And their stellar staff truly love these animals.  It's genuine.
I do quite a bit a rescue, and sweet Sarah Mills, Katelyn and the rest of this amazing staff have boarded several rescues. Teaching these dogs basic manners training and socialization.  This work helps ensure they will have a successful adoption later!
Just Happy Hounds not only provides excellent care for your personal dog, they do extensive community outreach, and have saved countless dogs.  I can't say enough good about them!!!

name: james meredith
text: Very nice people. Stayed late to meet me so I could drop my dog off on a sunday!!!

name: Brittany Stephens
text:
My dog began daycare at JHH at approximately 6 months old and attended at least 2-3 times per week. I always thought she enjoyed it as she seemed excited to pull up and be dropped off. At around a year old, I started noticing a lot of staff turnover at the facility. Although I should have taken heed, I did not and my dog continued to attend day care regularly. I began noticing that my dog was very timid of the staff. In particular, she was called by one of the managers/trainers and immediately backed up, tail between her legs, and laid down in a submissive position behind me. This time I took note and my dog never returned to the facility. I still have pre-paid day care days that will go unused. When I inquired about my dog’s reaction, it was explained to me by staff that my dog was regularly kept separate in a kennel in the back during the day. AND, that her “training” involved being taken into the yard, on a leash, while other dogs were allowed to approach her and she was given commands to obey. THIS RUINED MY DOG. She has dog aggression issues to this day, largely due to her extreme anxiety which I believe was engrained into her at a developmental stage while at JHH. Please do not take your dog to this facility for daycare.

Also, please note that most of the favorable reviews were posted at least a year ago. While the more recent reviews question the dogs well-being at the facility.

name: Emma Tolbert
text: Terrible! I paid $74 per night for my 2 senior-age shelties to be boarded in the “Beach House” suite while I was out of town. When they were picked up they were soaking wet and filthy, as if they had been left outside in the rain. They were also hungry, and an excess of their food was left that should not have been if instructions were followed. Definitely would not recommend if you are looking for your pets to be well taken care of!

name: Christina Fortugno
text: Just Happy Hounds needs to be your first and last look at daycare for your best friend. I moved to Birmingham a few months ago and did not know a soul. I came for graduate school with my best friend (Oliver) and the center of my world. I shopped around for daycares like my peers do for their human children. I chose Just Happy Hounds because the staff was friendly and I loved how my dog was always playing. He does not spend hours alone in a kennel like he would at home. They have far exceeded my expectation for customer service and outright exceptional care for my puppy. Oliver had a scratched cornea from playing a little hard and required surgery. I was stressed about what to do. I thought I could not take him to daycare while he recovered for surgery. He required extensive medications and needed to watched more closely in the cone of shame. The JHH team took care of Oliver post-op just as well as I would have at home. I never have to worry about my best friend while I am at work/class all day. I know he is being loved and played with as he is at home. I could not be more thankful for such incredible care of Oliver during his time of extra need. As a nurse, I am always caring for everyone else. I have been incredibly thankful to have someone help me out and give me peace of mind. Never bring your baby somewhere else! Sarah and her team are incredible. JHH is the best home away from home you can bring you furry friend to.

name: Abigail Martin
text: I have been trying to contact them for the last ten days after my dog was groomed here. I have called and emailed to no avail and have heard nothing back. I have many concerns with how well he was supervised the hours he spent here.

name: Drew Griffith
text: I took Buddy for grooming Savannah the groomer did a excellent job in grooming Buddy. Buddy smells wonderful.  He was full of matts when I dropped him off and know he is not. Savannah has done the best job of any grooming place I have ever talking buddy to

name: Kayla Rivera
text: They are wonderful with my dog. I have needed to leave before on fairly short notice and they have always been accommodating. My dog comes back happy. I will always feel comfortable leaving my dog there.

name: Anna Waters
text: I take my dog here once a week,  and he loves it. He hasn't always gotten along with other dogs, but he is so much more sociable now after a few months of weekly daycare. The staff at JHH is so nice and helpful, and I trust their judgment. Their services are also really affordable. I can't recommend them highly enough.

name: Cj Paxton
text: I have a giant breed dog ( Cane Corse  @ 160 lbs. )  Sarah and her crew have been great with him. He loves going there to play and hang out. No other place want to work with him because of his size. Wish I lived closer to them we moved and he isn't able to go now but I will have vacation soon. And he will be there for 12 days.

name: Raphael Cohen
text: Pasta and ambiance are both good. Great lunch place

name: Matthew Spivak
text: My dogs HATE getting groomed, but JHH was incredible! I could tell they genuinely cared for my boys and went the extra mile to make them feel comfortable. My dogs were in a much better mood when I picked them up compared to other places.

name: Stephanie Agee
text: It was okay I had to keep calling for the groomer, after she was reached I took my puppy in for a bath in a couple of days he was oily

name: LaBrena Friend
text: I have found out that Sarah is no longer at JHH. I will not be returning my dogs to JHH. I always knew my dogs were in the best care when Sarah was there and no longer trust that my dogs will be in good care without Sarah being there

name: mylilgigi2018 Mills
text:
Mrs Cole
Sorry you feel like this about JHH, but I can’t  imagine Sarah ever yelling at anyone her companion for what she does is above all.
The  dedication  she puts into running to JHH  is fabulous I wouldn’t put my baby anywhere else.

name: Bethany Cryder
text: Gracie loves her day care days.  I love the staff.  They treat her so wonderfully. Cannot recommend them enough.

name: Taylor Stroud
text: We have been taking our dog here for over a year now. She absolutely loves it. She gets excited whenever we ask her if she is ready "to go to daycare". They love taking care of our pup and do a great job. definitely recommend, especially those working close by at UAB and Children's

name: Terry Pribyl
text: Great service my dog loved the people. Kept my Lumpy for a day in a pinch, and didn't even charge us for the first visit.

name: Bryan Reed
text: Attended the Birmingham Bowl on the way home to Texas on a road trip.  I needed a place to keep our dog during the football game.  The folks at Just Happy Hounds were great.  My dog was actually sad to leave her newly acquainted canine friends.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: mark gotfryd
text: The dog returned happy but lost weight. From being active all day or under fed??. She was returned with multiple bumps... insect bites... Flea?.. Gave her bravecto. The people are very very nice and obvious dog lovers...

name: Julie King
text: Friendly staff. 1st class care for your furbaby. Easy to find. Groomer does a great job. It's easy to get an appointment and prices are comparable to other less fancy places. There's a great vibe at Just Happy Hounds and I will continue to take my little beloved furbaby there! She got a groom that was precious but not as short as I needed for her comfort due to hotspots and they didn't hesitate to fix it for free. Great place!

name: Julie King
text: They do a good job and love my nany

name: Caywood Yamnik
text: I took my dog here for a year and a half and still they did not know her name, and called her a boy almost every time. The staff has very high turnover, and there seems to be a big internal communication issue.

name: Mark Reeder
text: Great way to get the extra energy out of our puppy plus learn socialization skills. Great place for boarding as well.

name: Kelly King
text:
I would like to say I’ve been to several doggie daycares and Just Happy Hounds by far is the BEST!!!!
You can really tell they care about your baby! I have to tell you about my experience with them today. I dropped my baby off for the first time today for her boarding I
was greeted by Sarah and Josh with warm welcomes. The others staff wanted to know exactly want Annabella need during her stay food, bath how much when. I have to say JHH has it together and I can tell Sarah is there because she loves the babies. Now I can go on my trip with no worries! Thank you JHH staff for all you do.

name: Shay Hoffman
text:
Very friendly staff however the groom on my Pomeranian wasn't quite up to snuff. I took him in at the end of March 2017 for an all over trim down to 1/2" (tail included), specific attention to his ears, and a sanitary cut.
The overall cut was uneven around his face, legs, and tail - it looked chunky, spots were missed and others cut too short. The sanitary cut was what I asked for but I noticed a razor burn/cut on the inside of his leg after we got home. They did a great job on his ears which is usually a tough spot so it seems odd that the other stuff was so spotty.
This groomer just doesn't seem to have the skill for my dog's coat or their prices. We won't be going back.

name: Leah Moseley Papp
text: My dog loves coming here and the staff is great.

name: Yashna Patel
text: My dog received an injury, it was hard to contact anyone who knew about the situation and management did not cooperate or empathize. My dog suffered a large bruise and blood spot on her back left leg. I had to call several times and finally got ahold of management. They did not find out how the injury happened and I finally had to take my dog to the vet. Also, I requested nail trimming while my dog boarded and they forgot to do so. I scheduled a drop off for my dog for boarding and no one was in the office to receive her though I let them know ahead of time. I definitely do not reccommend this place.

name: Dona Bonnett
text:
"We are so pleased with Just Happy Hounds Midtown.  The dog groomer did a fabulous job on Trouble, our 11 year old rescue dog and we definitely recommend Just Happy Hounds Midtown in Birmingham for anyone needing dog grooming, boarding, dog daycare or training. This is a wonderful new dog facility and the staff is great - thanks so much for taking such good care of my baby!  Dona Bonnett-adr Business & Marketing Strategies

We have had both of our dogs groomed several times and have been very pleased each time.  The dog groomers do a great job.  They are courteous and love the pups.  Copper loves to play at doggie daycare with the other dogs while he is at Just Happy Hounds.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: Rachel Popwell
text: I have taken my Cocker Spaniel here for over a year now & we love it!

name: Cory Truett
text: Dog grooming did not come out well. I recommend going elsewhere.

name: Crystal Trinidad
text: Dog grooming is fairly priced and reliable

name: Anne Marie Miller
text: My pup pepper is beyond hyper!!! We do everything to wear her out! Every time she visits happy hounds she comes home tuckered out and happy!!! Forever a fan!!!!

name: Sarah Mills
text: At Just Happy Hounds they love them Like they are there own.....

name: Kyle Pérez
text: Not only do the folks at JHH really care for your pup like you would but their trainer, LaDale, is absolutely fantastic.

name: sandy lawrence
text: Horrible mangagement  fed my one year old lab a half cup of food for four days.   STAY AWAY

name: Jennifer Griffith
text: Poorly managed company with lots of issues that need to be worked out.  Would not recommend

name: Tracy Harris
text: Awful service. I would never go here.

name: Emily
text: Terrible management. DO NOT GO HERE.

name: Ashley Tate
text: The best doggy daycare EVER!!!!!!

name: Ravin Mooney
text: Love the staff at JHH!!!

name: Jeff Mills
text: Love, love, love JHH!

name: dominique boyd
text: I had the best experience with Classy Pup. She was very professional, and did an awesome job grooming My puppy Gizzee'. She also has wonderful fragrances for puppies. I was very pleased, and I will definitely return for services in the future.

name: M Lowery
text: My dogs love Lisa and her assistants! Icee and Coco are always so clean and sweet smelling after a bath! Lisa does such a great job on the grooms- absolutely adorable!!

name: Rachel Seaborn
text: Lisa is wonderful! She loves what she does and always does a great job with grooming our two dogs. We have a toy Poodle and toy Australian Shepherd. She’s reliable, friendly, responsive, always accommodating making appointments and always takes care of our two dogs. We’d definitely recommend her!

name: Sandy Bain Moon
text:
I use Classy Pup in Hoover for my schnoodle Macee.  Lisa gets it done right! Never have to worry about a bad cut,  I highly recommend her services.
Sandy Moon

name: Leslie Shadwick
text: I’ve taken my Shih Tzu several places in town and I knew the minute I dropped my puppy off we would continue to use Classy Pup. I know she takes care of my puppy and does a great job grooming him. I will not take my puppy anywhere else. Classy Pup will forever be my groomer.

name: Sara W
text: Today we took our dog to Lisa at Classy Pup for the first time. Previously he has had some grooming anxiety, but Charlie ran right up to Lisa with no issues. He was also napping and very happy when I picked him up. It means a lot to us that he feels comfortable there. Lisa was extremely nice and I was very happy with his haircut. He had not been groomed for some time and I knew it was going to be a big job. You can tell that Lisa and her staff love the dogs they work with. Furthermore, this business is taking every necessary precaution to protect themselves and their clients from covid-19. Their space is very clean and decorated so nicely. We will definitely be coming back on a regular basis!

name: Lindsey Dobbs
text: The young lady is a talented groomer and the owner and staff were super nice and polite! The best grooming I've seen and had done for my dog in a long, long,  time! I definitely Recommend there service to anyone!!!ask for Lindsey if you want the best groomer in Birmingham!

name: Julie Orr
text: I called ahead to ask if they could just trim my dogs nails bc I have a large breed, short haired dog that I can bathe easily. They said no problem, when we got there they talked my husband into getting the dog a bath also. Our dog wasn’t ready to be picked up for 4.5 hrs and they didn’t even trim his nails! So, I have spent far more than originally intended and I will need to spend more money to have his nails done somewhere else. Will not be returning.

resp.text: We did not  talk your husband into a bath for your Rhodesian ridgeback! .When asked if the dog was here for a bath AND nails service your husband went outside to ask someone and came back in a few minutes later and said yes. We had bear scheduled for nails only and graciously found time to bathe him for you. Typically nails  are an in and out service for us. That is why he was here for several hours. Bears nails did NOT need to be done.... you were only charged $50 for a bath on an extra large dog.. You could have given us a call and we would have gladly waived the bath fee before leaving an untruthful post but not now. By the way he tipped us $10.00

name: Michael Chelewski
text: I called several places this morning to see if I could get my Great Pyrenees bathed, groomed, and hair cut with no availability.  I contacted Classy Pup and they told me to bring her right in.  The process took less than 3 hours, which is amazing for this breed of dog.  The cost was right in line with everywhere else I've brought her to.  Very friendly staff and they made my Great Pyrenees look wonderful!!!  Thank you!!! I strongly recommend Classy Pup!!!

name: Madie Taylor
text: If I could give Classy Pup zero stars, I would. I called and they said if I dropped my tiny dog off between 8am-10am they would fit her in. To my surprise when we arrived at 9:15am, they said she would be ready around 4Pm. This should have been the first red flag for me. At 4pm we drove to go pick her up. When we arrived, they said she would not be done until 5:30pm. My poor tiny pup had been put in a cage for over 8 hours! I can only pray they gave her water because when she got home she drank almost a whole bowl. She was one of the first dogs to arrive, but yet was the last dog they groomed. When I made the appointment they told me it would be $49. That sounded reasonable and fair. When we picked her up after asking for a teddy bear cut, her haircut looked awful. There are random clumps of hair that are twice as long as the other pieces. She still has hair in her eyes from the side where they gave her bangs? When a teddy bear cut does not have bangs on the sides. When she was picked up. It ended up being $60. Much more than they quoted me. If I were you, I would never ever bring your pet to this shop.

resp.text: Hi Ms Taylor!  We are trying our best to fit everyone in because of the covid19 virus.  That being said we have a lot of new customers we are trying to help , along with servicing our regular ones. If you would contact us we will do whatever it takes to fix your concerns. It would have been more courteous to contact us about your concerns before posting something like this.... because I cannot find your name anywhere on our schedule within the last 2 weeks to call you. We also warn EVERYONE right now that their pet might be here almost all day . We do the dogs in order of arrival and our drop off time is between 8 and 10 am. it is not unusual if your dog was dropped off at 915 it was one of the last dropped of, and one of the last to finish up with.  Also.. we have no grooming packages priced at $49.00. Our bath and tidy's are $48 for our small dogs, and $58 for a full groom. we charge a $2 convenience fee for payments made with a credit card. Debit cards no convenience fee. Also keep in mind that it sometimes takes a time or 2 to get your puppy styled exactly as you because we don't know them , especially if you are new! We have been in business 37 years and if we were poor groomers that wouldn't be the case. Our longevity speaks for itself!

name: Survivor Girl
text: I have been taking Maxx to Classy Pup for least 6 years. Lisa is always professional and she does a wonderful job grooming Maxx. I have no worries when I drop off because I know when I pick him back up, he will well groomed and smells 10 times better. If you are looking for a professional dog groomer then Classy Pup is your place. I know it is mine!

name: Terry Hall
text: Lisa has been so patient with me. I had to cancel on her after her going to work my fur baby. I called her back and she set my baby up for today. I am so excited, I can’t take my eyes off of him he is so cute. My mother took care of my dog for many years and she would be crazy about his new look. Thanks Lisa for making him so beautiful today! ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

name: Sheri Arnold
text: First class service!  I have a (big) standard poodle and they did an amazing job with my 9 month old boy.  He is still new to grooming and they were very patient and caring with him.

name: Kathy Petro
text: Just started taking my dog here - and I love it!!! I have an older dog, and they were so sweet to him. Very impressed with the service and friendly staff.

name: matt harel
text:
I made a first attempt at an appointment for my two small poodle mixes on Friday 4/10 to be groomed on Saturday 4/11. Seemed easy enough. They asked me to have the dogs at the shop between 8-10a.

My mother fell ill Friday night, and I immediately took her to the urgent care Saturday morning, which was the morning I was scheduled to bring the dogs in. With the current health pandemic plaguing our country, and specifically Jefferson county, I immediately focused on getting my mother the healthcare needed. Unfortunately, I failed to inform Classy Pup, and missed my appointments.

I called this morning, Monday April 13th, and I apologized and tried to explain the predicament I was placed in on Saturday. Whomever I spoke with was extremely rude, and would not let me finish speaking without overpowering and overwhelming the conversation. She at some point mentioned I’m required to pre pay for both dogs (mind you I’ve never used their service and don’t know how I feel about prepaying), as well as for the appointments I missed? Because I didn’t give them a 24 hour notice? My mother fell ill the evening before the appointments were scheduled, it would be impossible to give a 24 hours notice for this.

It was all very bizarre, and confusing. I’ve used the same groomer for five years, and she recently went out of business and moved states; I’m certain I can find another groomer to take care of my dogs’ needs, but it’s shameful Classy Pup is so tone deaf and belligerent. Terrible customer service. The lady I spoke to even hung up on me. Again, with COVID-19 shuttering businesses left and right, you would think Classy Pup would be happy with two new clients, but unfortunately that doesn’t seem to be the case.

resp.text:
Hi Matthew, well wishes to your mother. You spoke with me the owner.  As I remember our conversation it was several days after your appointment you called to make another one.  No mention of your mothers illness and a very lighthearted  attitude about your missed appointment.  That is a huge deal to a small business, being that we had a hole of 2.5 blocked off hours in our schedule due to your dogs not coming in. Businesses cannot operate that way! And it was an appointment blocked off for 2 dogs... not one.   Our business model requires a prepayment deposit to be make after 2 missed appointments, that will be credited to the following appointment. Two dogs no showing is 2 appointments missed and lost revenue for us. We are not always able to fill those appointments last minute, as was the case. This is only our way of insuring that we will not have an empty slot in the future, not a  harsh personal attack as you infer.
Regards, Lisa

name: Jessica Stodden
text: We just rescued a Pomeranian and needed a place to get her groomed. Lisa and her helper were so friendly and did a great job! We will definitely be back! Thank you!!

name: Mara Okshteyn
text: Lisa is great! My dog loves her!

name: Alyssa Branton
text: I had a great experience at Classy Pup! Lisa was so helpful and personable. She kept my little dog safe and cozy while I was stuck at work. I also love the cut she gave my Yorkie!

name: Tammy Holston
text: I love Classy Pup!  I've taken my dogs there for years.  Lisa, the owner, always does her best to accommodate my schedule- even when I schedule an appointment last minute.  Good cuts at a good price too! ❤️

name: Grace Arello
text: They did such an amazing job on my dog and were so friendly and prompt !!! I have been bringing her back ever since I loved them so much I brought my moms dog too!!

name: Diane Burns
text: Lisa, the owner, is very friendly, professional and loves my dog! she is an excellent groomer and knowledgeable on dogs' health as well! Thanks for taking care of my dogs all these years! she has seen me through 3 dogs!

name: Matthew Martin
text:
We rarely leave a review on google, but decided I would since we never received a call back from the owner. My family and I moved to the Hoover area earlier this month and decided to try this groomer out. The owner was very friendly and the staff was great at arrival. Once the doggy cut was complete we went home and didn’t think anything about looking for imperfections with the groomer’s work. Once we got home we noticed that he had been severely cut around his face and has been bleeding for a week since the cut. His haircut  was also patchy and not cut to the standard we are accustomed to. The following week my wife tried multiple times to get I touch with the owner and was unable to get her on the phone or by visiting the salon. We spoke to her sister and left a message, and to no avail have we heard back. The haircut was around 65$ after tax and the matting fee. I as very disappointed in the lack of follow up and quality of work done. My dog still has scars on his face from the haircut. Please use this groomer with caution.

I wish we could upload pictures but google will not allow. We tried to handle this in-house for the past week and a half, but have heard nothing back from the groomers.

resp.text:
We rarely get bad reviews, but we do not look at it negatively.  On the contrary, we look at them as a chance to improve and enhance our business practices and take your suggestions.  This one has us very perplexed.Accidents do happen, but we would never send a dog home knowingly injured without notice and explanation.
I have checked out client sheets and have not found a Matthew M. signed in or  a charge for $65.  We are not in the office when we do not have clients scheduled, nor do I have a sister who works here. I have a small smooth coated dog and I know every  bump, swirl or wrinkle on that dogs body, and would immediately know if there was a cut or any abnormality on him . Once a dog leaves our care however, we have no control over what happens to him... but after a week????  We also have a waiver  clearly stating out policies on our client sheet that must be signed before drop off. We carry insurance and also have cameras installed. It is distressing that something happened to your dogs face. but if we didn't see. it we couldn't point it out to you!

name: Sharon Daniels
text: Lisa at Classy Pup has always taken such good care of our dog, Coconut.  We never think of going anywhere else.  We highly recommend her!

name: Kendyl Webb
text: First impressions mean a lot, and my first impression was horrible. The business is located in the downstairs of a building which you access from behind the building. There is no sign indicating this at the front of the building. When I arrived I parked up front and opened the front door to find an abandoned filthy building. I quickly closed the door and ran back to my car. I almost left then, but decided to drive around behind the building. That is when I saw the downstairs door. The upstairs door should be locked with a sign instructing you to go around back. When you get inside everything looks dated, but that's not the problem. I dropped my dog off at 1030. I was told that she would be done around 2 possibly 3 but that I would receive a call 30 minutes before she was ready. I was also told that she would be taken out of the kennel to walk and for a potty break (although there's no grass for this that I saw). At 1:30 I called to check and was told that it would definitely be 3 but that she would call 30 minutes before she was done and she sounded aggravated that I called. At 230 my husband and I decided to leave to pick up some lunch before picking the dog up, and at 309 I still hadn't heard from her. At that point my dog had been there almost 5 hours so I just headed straight there. I got there and she was still working on my dog but only for about 5-10 more minutes after I got there even though I hadn't received a call that she was 30 minutes from being done. Almost as soon as my dog was on the floor she peed which leads me to believe she was never walked or taken out to potty. She was shaved WAY shorter than I asked for her to be. I asked for a simple trim and instead she was shaved with a #5 blade. The lady argued with me and told me that I told her to cut her short, which I did not do. I was also told that it would be 50$ and I was charged 55$. We will not be back here.

resp.text: Hi Kendra!  Gee.. if you had a problem I wish you would have taken it up with me before you proceeded to write many inconsistencies!  First.... the upstairs building does not belong to me..... and Lorna Music just moved out with in a weeks time... and is in the process of cleaning it up! Our sign clearly shows the entrance to our business is the bottom level!   Secondly.... we were nice enough to take your Maltese withOUT an appointment and work it in around our other regular customers.  Our regular price for our small dogs is $55.00 and I usually charge a bit more for people without appointments .. so thats what we get for being nice to first time customers! Thirdly.... your dog was the LAST to come in... so it was the LAST to go out. It wouldn't have been fair to the other owners now.... would it?  Lastly... your dog was not in good shape so it had to be taken down short as I explained when you picked her up. Your dog also pee pee'd and poo poo'd in her cage as soon as you  dropped  her off so yes... she was walked thoroughly after that..... and Yes.... we have a very large dog run right next to the shop which you again did not observe... and plenty of grass out back!  I'm sure you can find another groomer that is better suited for you.             Lisa

name: Mallie B
text: I have a very nervous and scared little 7 month Yorkie because of her past groomer. Bella Rose is a very difficult baby to deal with. Instead of saying she would not groom her again, Lisa is working with me and giving me recommendation to talk to her doctor about. That is amazing and shows she  really loves what she does. Do not pay attention to any bad reviews. I'm hear to tell you that Lisa was in constant contact with me all day and even tho my baby was a terrior, she looked amazing. We will not use anyone else.

name: Sandra Slate
text: I have been using Classy Pup for over a year with my Shihtzu/Bichon. They do a great job and always call as soon as he is ready. He is not scared to go in which says a lot to me after some experiences at other places that he did not want to stay.

text: Darrell and Angie are amazing breeders of British Labs. The care, love, and dedication they pour into all their dogs and young pups is evident and palpable. name: Melissa Tapp
text: Everyone went above and beyond with our dog Chloe and we were very happy! This was the first time we used North Alabama Animal Hospital and even with having to do curbside check-in due to the Covid-19 issues, everyone was very professional and responsive. Dr. Thompson called me off and on during the visit to discuss treatment and recommendations for Chloe and explained everything in a way we could understand. We will continue to use them for Chloe and for our other pets as well!

name: Caitlyn Brewer
text: They make everything so convenient from making appointments to refilling meds. I brought my fur baby there when my old vet was insisting apoquel was a fix all for my dogs allergies even after I told her it had stopped working. NAAH listening to everything I had to say and helped me look for answers. Now my baby is on Cytapoint and feeling so much better! This dog mamas heart is happy

name: William Cooper
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with animal care specialists!

name: James Lamar
text:
Had Christmas plans to come to Muscle Shoals to visit my dad and then on to Monroe, LA to visit my son. I sent a message to North Alabama Animal Hospital inquiring about boarding. Dr. Thompson called me and answered all of my questions and even invited me to come to the office for a tour when I got in town.  I took my Cavalier King Charles, Sam, with me for the tour and everyone was so nice. I had no concerns after the visit on what kind of care my Sam would be given. The next day I took Sam in and he stayed 3 nights. When I picked him up there were no issues at all. The staff is great and the rates are very reasonable. I’ll definitely board him there again in the future.

James

text: Always leave feeling my pets have had the best of care

name: Maps
text: I'm not a local and came into the area for family reasons. I needed a vet to go to and my brother told me to go here. It's the best around he said. I'm biased as I love my vet at home but when I walked in I was impressed just by the looks. Neat, organized and clean with plenty of space for people bringing in their fury family members. Everybody was very friendly... From the staff to the techs and docs.. Even other customers! Great atmosphere. My dog is special to me as she is my medical service dog and I require different methods of care with vets that not a lot will provide. Not here... They were awesome and did everything I asked for and then some. Above and beyond! If I lived in the area, this place would be my only place. If they were where I'm from I would switch in a heartbeat.. Of you love your fury friends then you should be taking them here for care.

The vet tech was so personable, and I could tell she really cared about Madix. We have surgery on the 10th, but they are going to do additional testing before to make sure anesthesia is safe. Top notch vet office, will definitely recommend.

text: We have used NAAH for seven years now, and recommended them without reservation. My dogs have experienced some health issues here and there, some serious, others not, and not a single time has a diagnosis been incorrect or a treatment ineffective (which I realize can happen even under stellar care, but its worth noting). They do not run pricey tests without your go-ahead, but lay it all on the table for you to choose. Also, we drive 70 miles round trip and it is worth it. So, trust your pets to the care there and you will not be disappointed.

name: Desiree Perkins
text: Took my pup here for a few months and he seemed to love it. Came home exhausted each time as if he had a blast. As far as the friendliness of the staff, that was a hit or miss, honestly. I only interacted with one lady who I think may have been the owner that was really really sweet. Anyone else would come get my puppy from the car in the mornings, not say good morning or anything, just grab him and walk inside. I don’t know a single staff member’s name because no one ever introduced themselves to me. His very first day at daycare, he came home with scratches on his face from where he’d gotten into a fight with another dog. His second time at daycare, I got a call from one of the staff members there letting me know that he’d got bitten in the head by another dog & was asked if I wanted to come pick him up. I debated on not going back after that but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. A few weeks later, my puppy contracts Kennel Cough from there which ultimately developed into pneumonia. As any other pet parent, I was angry because every dog is supposed to be fully vaccinated in order to attend there. $250 later, thankfully, he made a full recovery. I didn’t take him back for weeks because I was paranoid. However, I moved closer to the area and decided to give it another shot. Took him back on a Friday. A few days later, I notice he isn’t feeling well & end up having to take him to the emergency vet at 2:30 am. What have you know, Kennel Cough AGAIN. He’s been sick now for almost two weeks. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this facility. Ever.

resp.text:
Hello Desiree, thank you for reaching out to us with a review.  Our COVID Care protocols have definitely made it much more difficult for our staff to interact with our clients with conversations.  We have really missed these interactions too!  We do feel strongly that our curbside dropoff/pickup services as well as our staff wearing full PPE is in the best interest of our community, our clients, and our staff - but it has definitely left us missing those close interactions and relationship building with our clients.  I'm sorry you missed that too.  We are definitely learning how to best create relationships with our clients in the climate of COVID safety.  Your feedback will be very helpful as we continue to grow and change with these new and ever changing restrictions.

I'm also sorry to hear your pup got cough while he was participating in our services.  This particular strain of cough this year has actually made several national news stories as it has shown up all over the country.  It's been a nasty strain.  We worked very closely with our veterinary advisory team to be sure we were utilizing the absolute best practices in cleanliness and disinfectant protocols throughout our facility.  We also did our best to inform all clients honestly and openly about the outbreak.  We feel very fortunate that we were able to get it under control so quickly because of our amazing veterinary advisory team.  Just like childcare, dog daycare does pose a slightly higher risk of dogs getting upper respiratory infections and sometimes GI upset in group play.  We do our very best to inform our clients of this by having it clearly stated in several places on our General Client Agreement all clients receive and sign before their first day of daycare with us.  While we sincerely wish the bordatella vaccine required by our facility was able to protect against all cough, just like the human flu vaccine, it does not.

Again, we appreciate your feedback and wish you and your dog well and that you are able to find another facility that suits your needs.  Please let us know if we can help you with any pet care needs in the future.

name: Jordan Davis
text: I was really excited to get my dog Mallard into training at Roverchase. That excitement was short lived however when I registered online for the Orientation class online for $50 only to find out it doesn’t exist. My wife and I drove 40 minutes for the class and were then told the class didn’t exist and no one was there to train. So they took our name and number for the owner to call us and get us a refund. The owner did end up calling a week later from an unknown number and left a voicemail. I have subsequently called six more times to try to get ahold of the owner. Most of the time I was told she was out and would call me. She never called. On one occasion I spoke to the manager and he was going to call me back. Never called me back. At this point I guess I’m using this as a $50 life lesson to never pay ahead of time (despite their policy that the price goes up if you pay there). We will have to find another trainer to get our dog certified with Hand in Paw because I will not take our dog here. They had multiple chances to remedy the situation and we were understanding of the issue, but the lack of customer service and failure to even call back or refund us is unacceptable.

name: Jeremy Knezek
text:
This review only describes the Puppy Class and I have no other experience with this establishment. However, I found the classes to be ridiculously unprofessional. They charge the going rate, $20 per 1 hour class session for 4 sessions. However, the classes never start on time, the instructor is rarely prepared with her materials, generally she is looking at her phone several times per lesson and disappearing into another room, and 2 of 4 classes ended early. The instructor clearly knows how to train a dog, however this place has a business model based on you dropping your dog off for several weeks and a thousand or more dollars later they train the dog for you. I have no doubt she is exceptionally effective in that environment, but these classes where you learn to train your dog yourself are over complicated, incoherent, and lack any kind of structure. I feel like mostly they are used to get you to admit you need to drop your dog off with them, because that is the only way the dog will get trained. I've had better experiences with a big box store training, and that isn't saying much. There are significantly better training places for the same money with a whole lot less agenda. Hint: look for a non-profit dog obedience and training club.

Response to the owner: First off, it's labelled a rolling class. You don't need to offer "a missed class at no extra charge", that's part of it being rolling. You show up for 4 classes, whether they are consecutive or not, and I checked ahead of time to make sure that was the case. Second, in 3 of the 4 classes there was no socialization time unless you count the period of time we all waited in the office while the instructor was running late. Ending the class early twice ensured no socialization time. You offer 14 days of board and train for $1100 and 28 days for $2100. Both of those cost more than the thousand dollars I put in my review. So yes, you offer both cheaper and more expensive options, personally I think I hit the middle pretty well with my review. I put in my review you charge the going rate. I don't dispute that. I also said the trainer knows how to train dogs, the trainer simply didn't do much to help people learn to train their own dogs in this one class. Finally, the Birmingham Obedience and Training club is a non-profit club, they just aren't a charity. I find the vast majority of your response to my review to have been very misleading.

resp.text:
Hello Jeremy,
I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your Puppy Kindergarten class with us.  I am the owner of Roverchase and you have not contacted us in your 4 week training so, until this review, I was unaware of your unhappiness.  I have called the other puppies in your class period and they have all been exceptionally pleased and have all signed up for additional group classes for continuing education, so I am a bit confused.  I would be more than happy to talk with you about your experience.  I do know that your dog missed a week of Puppy Kindergarten and we were very happy to accommodate your schedule and allow you to makeup your missed class at no additional charge.     Puppy Kindergarten is a socialization and basic manners class and not a true "training skills" course.  This is very clear in the description of our class on our website as well as the materials given in each class period.  As mentioned previously, I would be more than happy to speak with you about your experience, please feel free to call the front office at 205-332-0203 and ask for Abigail.  Also, as a note, our day-training program is our most popular program but it is hardly "thousands of dollars."  Most of our clients spend between $250-450 for four weeks of all day training where they drop their dog of several times a week each week.  This is hardly "thousands of dollars" and is, in fact, some of the best prices is town.  Our Puppy Kindergarten class is also priced competitively with "the big box store" but you are taking this class from one of the most highly experienced and certified canine behavioral consultants in the city.  As an additional note, our prices are less expensive then the Obedience Club in our town, which is not non-profit.  Birmingham does not have a non-profit training club.
