name: Bart Masters
text:
I've had an incredible experience with Roverchase. I have found the staff to be incredibly knowledgeable and effective with training. I love their philosophy and approach. They are extremely professional but also fun.

Bringing a puppy into a home with 2 small children is no small task, so their daycare package has been a life-saver for me when I'm too worn out to wear my puppy out. They wear him out, train him, and act as advisors.

You can tell they really care about, not only the dogs, but you as a customer. It's a pleasure every time I go there, and I love supporting a local, small business that's doing great work in my own backyard.

name: Bert Davi
text: Hard to find a place to trust with your four legged family members. This is that place for us highly reccomend

name: Kevin Auer
text:
I have gone through Roverchase group training which was fantastic. Aidan did a great job and took time to work on things that I specifically was having trouble with when there was not a big class. I took my dog to daycare and the owner, Abigail, stated that he was having trouble and recommended a behaviorist that comes to Roverchase every Thursday and Saturday. The price was $400 dollars which I was happy to pay because I really wanted the best for Blue (my dog). We talked with the behaviorist for about an hour and that was the end of the session. The behaviorist did not really teach or show me anything that I did not already know. The behaviorist did not even see the behavior that I was having trouble with but yet she was quick to write out a treatment plan. The behaviorist did say that I would need to do private lessons with Abigail which is not included in the cost. So for $400 dollars I talked to a lady for an hour. This is a big scam and I am really troubled that Roverchase would be a part of it.

My appointment lasted 1 hour. We left right after 5 and the appointment started at 4. So go back and check your cameras again. Yes, I was happy to pay the $400 dollars which I stated previously. But I was under the impression that I would get useful information and more than just talking to a "Behaviorist" for an hour. Again, how can she, the behaviorist, tell me what is the cause and real problem without even seeing the behavior. I even emailed the behaviorist trying to get a refund because that was not what I was expecting. Not even wanting a full refund because I understand that she did take time out of her day to meet with me. But I think she can keep the $80 dollars deposit and refund the $320 since I do not need her "expertise" any longer. But she has not responded to my email which she specifically stated was the best/fastest way to communicate with her. And as far as reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith...I did that. You decided to lie on your response by saying that you checked the cameras and that I was there for a little under 2 hours. Your cameras times are off or you lied. I told you that I actually loved Roverchase. I even recommended people go to y'all which only one of them did but one is better than none. But I do still think that I was scammed.

resp.text:
Dear Mr. Auer,
I’m so surprised to read your review regarding your experience with Blue and Dr. Beihunko, Roverchase, and the chain of events you described.  I appreciate you giving me the opportunity on this public platform to respond.
Firstly, I’m so glad you were pleased with your group classes at Roverchase with our trainer Aidan.  He’s so talented and our clients just adore him.  I’ll be sure to pass on your praise.  Thank you.
To address your concerns regarding your experience with Dr. Biehunko, I will do my best to address them in an organized fashion.
-  I recommended Blue see Dr. Biehunko when Blue presented to daycare last week after a 5 month absence from Roverchase.  Prior to Blue’s absence, we had discussed at length Blue’s increase reactivity and dog related aggression and you indicated you did not want to address it with us at that time but wanted to work with it on your own.  We advised against it.  When you presented last week, Blue came for a day of daycare and was significantly worse in all behaviors.  I recommended a consultation with Alabama’s only Veterinary Behaviorist, Dr. Biehunko.  I thoroughly explained how Dr. Beihunko’s consultations worked, that they were $400 and for that price you received a 1.5-2hr consultation with her expertise and she would make a diagnosis, a treatment plan, and then have 6 months of medical management and follow up.  I was very clear with you that there was no doubt that Blue would need additional lessons with me and that it would be at additional cost.  You remarked that you felt this price was fair for her experience and expertise and made your appointment for later in the week
- I do rounds with Dr. Biehunko each day for our shared clients.  She had already been thoroughly briefed on Blue’s behavior at Roverchase the day he returned as well as my notes from his behavior in December when we last saw him.
- Your consultation with Dr. Biehunko was just barely under 2hrs.  I checked the time stamp on our cameras
- In your consultation with Dr. Biehunko we were all very surprised to hear that you insisted that Blue has received no training outside of his training at Roverchase.  In fact, you insisted this was true even when specifically questioned about this by Dr. Biehunko and the Roverchase trainers who sat in on the session with you.  As I’m sure you know, it’s extremely difficult for any doctor to communicate effectively and efficiently with a client when that client willfully withholds pertinent information from that doctor that impedes the treatment plan.  As you can see from the attached screen shots, not only has Blue been in training with another trainer, but it was for the very issue he was presenting for.
- Finally, since your consultation was just over 72 hours ago, and we are very clear that treatment plans can take 2-4 weeks to become effective, it’s hard to understand how you can already be so unhappy with your results.
I certainly believe that pet owners are allowed to train and handle their pets as they see fit and that there are many fits available for many different preferences.  However, I hope we can both agree that reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith and this one has some glaring issues.  I hope, in light of this, and in light of you many months of happiness with Roverchase, you will consider removing it.  We certainly wish you and Blue only the very best and much success in all of your endeavors.

Best wishes,

Abigail Witthauer
Roverchase

name: Joel Pitman
text: I received my Wonderful PTSD Service Dog "Birch"  from them...It's funny that people complain that Rover Chase doesn't do what they say they do... I'm sure if you left your K9 there to be trained, they trained it... I'm sure Rover Chase would be happy to post the video of how well your dog was trained. If you took your dog to the puppy classes and complain about it... the problem is you. The dog goes home with you. They are merely their to teach YOU how to train your dog at YOUR house. This failure is on both of you... I have significant time their. I'm in the military and I know what Blow Hards sound like. The issue is ya'll not Rover Chase it's you. Both of you get negative stars for lacking integrity and blaming others. Thank you have a bless day.

name: Jordan Wakefield
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR DOG HERE!!!! If I could give them negative stars I would. I took my Australian Shepherd here because they said they would help her with her people aggression issues. All they did was put her on medication that literally made her go crazy and she was even worse on the meds than off. And they told me to lock my dog in a room and never let her around anybody. That her best hope was for her to learn to wear a muzzle, that she would ever be able to be around people. When I tried to call for an appointment I never got a call back from them and I called and called for 3 weeks. It's been well over 2 months now and still haven't heard from them. Took my dog to Dale at Just Happy Hounds in Birmingham and she is a new dog. Completely off meds she never needed to be on and her aggression is under control. She absolutely loves 3 of the workers there and runs up to them to be petted. All I needed was someone to actually tell me what to do to help my dog. Not someone that just stuck her on meds so she would be too doped up to do anything. I have heard absolutely awful things about the people that work there from past owners that brought their dogs there. Please don't take your dogs there. They will not help them if they have a major issue that needs to be handled.

name: Pavlov Skinner
text:
As a two year employee of Roverchase, first as a kennel staff member and now as Head Training Intern as a training intern, I am a general witness to the management of the facility and dogs.  I can speak to the unending care this facility provides for your dogs. Our facility is an industry leader in the Southeast. With a low dog per yard Ratio, large staff per dog Ratio, FULL day care and boarding (meaning your dog is playing all day and never gets put up except for a 30 minute lunch and bedtime at 6:30pm if boarding, we have strict adherence to the humane and ethical treatment of animals, dog temperament evaluations to allow access to the facility, and two full time vet techs.  You can trust that roverchase has your dogs safety, happiness, and wellbeing at the top of their list of priorities. The training times, schedules, and criteria are strictly followed, and you will love the experience, knowledge, and end result of our many training options.  I would love to give you a tour anytime and show you the beautiful facility and explain to you all the education and care that goes into the practices and procedures surrounding your dogs each and every day at Roverchase!

-Aidan Nicholas

A great find to care for my dogs when needed instead of caged at the vet & exposed to illnesses from patients who come to the vet!

Very nice & ‘homey’. Dogs have a little vacation instead of ‘being boarded’. She takes great care of them, like they are all her own pets!!!

She is often full to capacity, especially around holidays, etc! Need to call & make reservations! Go by there & check it out & you’ll understand why!!!

Costs a bit more than vet boarding, but my animals aren’t Bored! Love my dogs & it’s well worth the little bit of extra money!!!

They’re happy when I pick them up, but not stressed & eager to see me to “get out of here”! HIGHLY Recommended!!!

A little out of the way, this cute little pet boarding facility is amazing! Montevallo Doghouse + Cats has a separate boarding area for small dogs is like a small hotel, complete with a bed and a door to a private fenced courtyard. However, separate small dog boarding is limited. Call early before holidays.

In addition, the playground and extra attention to the pets sets this boarding facility apart!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a kind review! We enjoyed your sweet girl's visit with us!

name: Rick James
text:
Would like to stop and thank Rebecca for all her help on the phone with me. She was kind and very informative on pricing, even let me walk around the facility. The rooms are more than enough for your pets and the amount of care given is above and beyond what I could have asked for. I was away overseas for 2 weeks and my 2 furry kids had a blast. I was even given email updates which adds peace of mind especially when I'm so far away.

To anyone looking to board your dogs or cats I highly recommend this facility. I personally wouldn't keep my pets anywhere else!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the thoughtful review. We are glad the pups had a good time! Love the photo! He is such a big baby :)

text: My boxers love it there.  They seem to know anytime we head that way and get so excited.  Hands down, the best boarder I have ever used.  I recommend them to everyone I know that needs to board their dogs.

text: We have used Montebello Doghouse 8 times over the last 1.5 years for trips ranging from a weekend to 2.5 weeks. Hands down they are the best place we have ever boarded out two dogs. I love that the dog house is a family run place too. My wife and I feel much better leaving our dogs with them as opposed to in a vet where they have a 4x4 concrete cage to stay in. Keep up the good work!

text:
I took my Lucy there for the first time because of the great reviews.  I had only made reservations for one night but Lucy had to stay for two due to unexpected work hours and Ms. Rebecca was more than accommodating.  She provided food for her since I did not pack enough.

When I arrived, Ms. Rebecca gave me a tour of the place and I was impressed.  Every dog had their own little room with a doggie door to the outside.  They even get one on one activity time with Ms. Rebecca.

Every time I take Lucy to the vet for day boarding, she cannot wait to go home. When I picked her up today, she did NOT want to leave. My feelings were hurt :( .....LOL!!  When I finally got her in the car, she jumped out when I turned my back to her wanting to stay. I was so happy to Lucy happy.   I now have peace of mind that when I need to board Lucy, she will only to go to Ms. Rebecca's knowing that is where Lucy will be well taken of.  Ms. Rebecca truly loves and cares for our babies.

text:
This place is great - Rusty really takes great care of my dog River. I learned about this place from some friends a couple months ago and River has stayed there 3 times now for up to three nights. She loves it there! The last time i went, i left her blanket and when I picked it her up Rusty had washed and dried her blanket (she probably made a mess...)

My dog is a senior and they are very sweet to her. She gets to romp around the big yard without a leash and she also has her own little private yard so she has some privacy as well.

She'll definitely stay here whenever I have to leave town from now on.

name: Kelly H2O
text:
If I could give this place a 20 star I would. Rebecca and Rusty are amazing people. They are so kind and sweet to the animals (and humans too).  Their facility is so clean I would stay there.  It's truly out of this world. I have been bringing my 4 dogs there for several years and know a few other people who won't bring their dogs anywhere else . The dogs and cat's don't stay in cages, they stay in little rooms with storm doors and the dog rooms have a little door at the back so they can go outside to their own private yard. In the winter there are heaters for each room that lower from the ceiling so dogs aren't cold. the cats have the cat trees in them so they'll have a place to curl up that's cozy and comfy.
The reviewer who said that it looks like they live near a bunch of meth addicts is ignorant.  The road to the Montevallo Doghouse does have mobile homes along it but most are well kept. That customer is so rude to assume that all people who live in mobile homes are addicts.   I have never had a problem with Rusty or Rebecca not being there and I've taken my dogs there many times through the years.  They are wonderful people.

The dogs aren't "caged" ....Our family went out of town for a few days and boarded them at our vet...we picked them up upon returning from our trip....one of my dogs had a cracked tooth and scraped and raw nose from apparently trying to bite his way out of the caged kennel. Never again will they go there. Planning a vacation and altho montevello is a far it's well worth knowing my dogs are in good hands, more like a doggie camp.

text:
We have Boarded our 2 labs here many times!! And were highly Pleased with the excellent care Bo and Sadie received! From, Rusty and Rebecca and Justin, their son too! So VERY polite and Loving to our precious puppys!! Tho, both our Puppys are sad when we drop them off!!?? They quickly adjust to their room...with the clear door!! And we Know that our black lab LOVES the constant access to their Own Private outside dog run!! During the Summer months the rooms have A/C in each one and in cool weather, there's a heater above them! Which is wonderful for our Puppys! Cuz they're surely to get into Trouble if a heater were near the floor!! Justin learned quickly! LOL! That our spoiled puppys were Very Used to Being Inside in the A/C!! When we had to extend a recent trip for another day and night!!? They were GREAT accommodating Our Needs...and Making Room for Bo and Sadie!! But they were outside ...in the Shade of coarse! But, Justin said that They Both were Over-Joyed!! When their Indoor room came open!! He explained that They BOTH were hilarious!! They're simply Spoiled Rotten....poor babies had to hang in the Shade for an hour or so!? Just 2 1/2 yrs ago...they both stayed outside except overnight and in bad weather!! LOL! And this most Recent visit last month....Rebecca described our Puppys...like She'd known them both for Years!! Telling me what Each of them did on their Nature Walks!!?? And she described Exactly how both Bo and Sadie ACT....& each of their mannerisms!!? MADE ME....KNOW FOR SURE THAT "SHE" HAD ACTUALLY SPENT ONE ON ONE ""TIME"" WITH THEM BOTH!!!❤ This last visit they stayed 6 nights in a room together!! Which is PERFECT!! And it was a mere $200!! They are a bit far away for us....cuz we live in Helena. But it really Not too bad a drive...at all, and the more we drive it ....the closer it seems! We Also use Montevallo Animal Clinic...for All our Furry Babies....our Puppys and Kitty's! So it's about maybe 8 minutes from there!! They've ALSO...worked with us when we Needed Later Drop off after normal hours!! Quite a few times! And as I said accommodated us having to Add an extra day & night!! THEY'VE JUST BEEN WONDERFUL FOR OUR PUPPYS!!❤ Makes Us NOT BE WORRYING ABOUT OUR BABIES EHILE WE'RE AWAY FROM HOME!!

LISA BRYAN....HELENA,AL...

text: dr baxter and his staff are some of the best most caring kind and compassionate i know i recently lost my little fur child molly he was compassionate kind and caring and thats hard to find in a doctor of any kind if all doctors were the same his staff take incredible care of the animals that come and those that stay in the kennels. dr baxter has a brilliant mind and hes like an expert so i respect and value his advice it was hard to say good bye but molly had an infected uterus and then infection was causing her body to shut down there was nothing anyone could do i hugged him and he left me to make my decision i couldnt just let my baby suffer so we chose to put her to sleep i was allowed to hold her paw and gaze into her eyes as she left this world and entered the spirit world. he then hugged me and his nurse wrapped my baby in her blanket and i brought her home and buried her under her favorite tree. dr baxter sent me a card that helped my mourning and meant alot he said i did the right thing now tell me what doctor would that other than a truly compassionnate person i give 5 stars

We travel up from Montgomery, and the services and care are well-worth the drive.

name: Mary Dunn
text: The staff is so nice and friendly! We were worried that our 4 month old puppy would be scared to death, but he loved it. We were there for 1day daycare. Will certainly be going back!

text: Gentle and caring with my pet, fees reasonable.  Respectful of appointment time..

name: Stephanie Kelley
text: I love the care that Willow and Holly get there!  And the place is always so clean which can't be said for most vets!  Dr B and the staff are always friendly,  caring and helpful!!

name: Kathy Gunn
text: Love Dr. Mary Battistella (and staff)!  Found her at a very sad and scary time right after the cancer diagnosis of my dog.  She is very knowledgeable and caring, and I'm so grateful I found her at such a very critical time.  After I chose not to do chemotherapy, but rather a more holistic/natural approach, my dog has done exceptionally well and has had a good quality of life under her direction and care, and she is still doing very well two years later!  I'm so very thankful for "Dr. B" and her staff!  Highly recommend!

name: Mike
text: My pets have been patients at Kowaliga Pet Care for five years.  The employees there are attentive, thorough and caring.  Doctor Mary Battistella has specialized knowledge in holistic healing, nutrition and medical practices.  She is very receptive and accommodating to the individual needs of customers and their animals and has unique training and experience to offer solutions beyond traditional veterinary practices and medicine.  There is also a large play room for animals who stay overnight.

name: Daniel Scruggs
text: I had an Emergency situation with my dog being ran over. After being turned down by another vet, these folks took my dog in and did what they could. They were very friendly, compassionate, and professional.

name: Paige Patterson
text: Dr MARY B has a successful practice because she practices from the Heart! Exactly what you want from your vet!

name: Pat Mason
text: Nice vet, nice staff.

name: Sherry Sexton
text: Best vet and very caring, looks at all aspects of health even alternative options

name: Ashlan Pitts
text: Amazing vet and employees! Especially Mrs. Charmin Pitts!

name: Katherine Richardson
text: Our dog is so happy to arrive at Walks and Wags every day! It’s extremely comforting to know our pup is having a great day and is well loved by a knowledgeable staff. Training and socialization are prioritized, and we love the open communication facilitated by Cindi and her team.

name: Stacy W
text: I cannot say enough about the great care that Walks and Wags provided for my Hershey while we were on vacation.  She has always loved going there for Doggie Daycare so I thought I'd give them a try for boarding as well.  They  did a fantastic job!!   I can honestly say that she loves this place as much as home.  Thanks to all of the staff for all that you do in loving and caring for our animals.

name: Quintin Wilder
text: I delivered to this fine loving place a few times and I must say it smells good very clean and the staff be on top of things and the love I seen them show the pets won me over I tried to get my dog in there around Christmas time and they was booked up so that should tell you people love this place and trust it highly recommended

name: Jim Stokes
text: went by for lunch, but the dining room was closed. went to checkers instead, because they have outdoor tables.

name: Marilyn Taylor
text: My Golden Retriever just got the most fabulous groom from Bre. She came home looking like a million bucks and smelled fabulous. Bre is truly a dog grooming artist. Just look at my dogs smiling face.

name: Delana Ibsen
text:
Walks and wags has been such a Godsend to us. When we started bringing her a couple years ago we had a pup that we couldn’t give the proper exercise or life experience to. Because of walks and wags we have been able to finally establish proper pack structure at home in a way that makes all of us happy and able to enjoy life together.
The entire staff have been so incredible to us and I can’t seem to find words great enough to express my gratitude for all you have done.

resp.text: You are an amazing dog owner. Keep up the great work.

name: C Sells
text:
EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE & STAFF!! Sooo kind and generous! 💞💞💞
They cared for our fur baby for a week and he was right at home!

name: Lauren Parker
text: Our dogs love coming here and getting the opportunity to learn social skills as they interact with other dogs.  We like how personal the caretakers are with us and our dogs.  They know the dogs’ likes and personalities.  I can go away on vacation and not have to worry about the dogs.  I know they are having a blast and they are in good hands!

name: Karen B
text: As a puppy, our dog began going to a weekly play-date at Walks & Wags.  She is five years old now and still loves her day with her friends each week.  She comes home tired, but happy, from constant play.  We also board her with W&W whenever we travel and it is wonderful to be able to leave her with no worries, knowing she will be cared for by people she knows (and loves).  She is more than happy to enjoy her vacation while we enjoy ours.  Cindie and her staff are excellent trainers, as well.  I give W&W my highest recommendation!

name: The Knockout Ladysaint23
text: Great place for your dog to run, play, have fun and spend time with their friends or make new ones. After playing, your dog also gets to take a nap. After naptime, your dog also gets a bath, their nails trimmed and they also get a lovely bow before going home. Grooming and training is also available. You can rest easy knowing your dogs are well taken care of by friendly and knowledgeable staff, that love your dog just as much as you do. Don't forget to check the Walks and Wags Facebook page daily, you might get to see a picture of your dog playing.

name: Herder
text: Amazing place i know from personal experience the staff is amazing

resp.text: Thank you so much.

name: Mary Duffy
text:
This is a wonderful place for your dog(s) to come. Not only do they get socialized with other dogs but they get in some great exercise. Cindie Carter and her staff are who really make this place work. Simply put, they love the dogs.
My dog has been coming 1-2 times a week for 4 years. He loves Walks & Wags. . His excitement grows once he realizes where we are going, until he all but bursts from the car. I recommend everyone bring their dogs to Walks & Wags.

name: Lauren Perry
text: Walks and Wags have been nothing shy of absolutely amazing. They have provided more assistance in the care and training of my puppy then I ever knew I needed. Every staff member at Walks and Wags is educated and knows exactly what they are doing due to the amount of training that they provide their employees. I’m so glad that I found them!

name: Brian O'Hear
text: The people here are amazing and friendly! They take great care of your dogs! It's hard to find people like this who care for pets this much. They treat you like family.

name: Sloan Blaylock
text: As a former kennel employee and current vet tech (at another establishment), I feel qualified to give Walks &Wags a thorough review.  The staff is incredible. They all have an undeniable love for animals and are extremely dedicated to keeping your four-legged family members happy and safe.  Small, well-supervised play groups ensure your dog gets the proper socialization he or she needs, while careful supervision prevents any dogs from being over stimulated. They take great care to make your dog feel at home. To top it all off, your dog receives a bath and is returned to you fresh and clean.  Walks & Wags is a gem of a place. Your dogs will thank you for bringing them to board and/or play!

name: Christine Ford
text: Our experience with Walks and Wags has been phenomenal! My 9 year old, old lady dog started once a week day care with them several months ago. After several weeks of getting oriented to the facility and the staff, my old, lazy dog began to run and play at home again! She chases and brings toys and is clearly a much happier, more relaxed dog. I can’t say enough nice things about Alex, the lady who greets her in the mornings. The groomer at Walks and Wags does an excellent job with out stressing the dogs. These people clearly love what they do!

name: Katie Mallinger
text:
My dog went to walks and walks for a several years before we moved to Tennessee. When we moved I tried another daycare for my dog, but when I picked him up he was more stressed than tired.
My dog and I are visiting the Mobile area this week and I took him to walks and wags for a day of fun. I drove in the driveway and he knew where he was, and his reaction was priceless.
I would recommend walks and wags to anyone that loves their dog as much as I love mine.

name: Buddy Arensberg
text: Staff were very professional. Communication was excellent.  My dog loves Walks and Wags, and they are working with him to develop better social skills.  Much more than a boarding facility.

name: C Lynn
text: We tried this facility a while back, very bad experience. Owner was extremely rude and our dog will not be returning.

resp.text: I am the owner and I have not been working  on location. I’ve been wrapping up end of year and training. I would love to discuss your experience with you and  see if we can  figure out a solution. Of course our staff and myself apologize for any miscommunication. We have tried to locate your name in our customer mgmt system and have no record. Please reach out and we will be happy to assist . Warmly, C. Carter

name: Ilka Porter
text: The entire staff is fabulous. They all truly care about your dog(s). Our Molly also got a great haircut by Katie. Highly recommend!

name: mjill gee
text: My dog is a regular at Walks & Wags and I can't say enough great things about what a wonderful Doggie-Daycare place it is.  The outstanding owners, Cindie and Larry Carter, and dedicated staff are true dog lovers and have a great understanding of the needs and personalities of all  the dogs that come to play -and/or board- there. They have a great set-up for tons of outdoor play and lots of special dog activities as well. It is the ideal place to leave your dog when you are not going to be home as their day will be full of fun, stimulating activities, tons of exercise (broken up by group nap-time!)  and best of all, love and affection - oh, and a bath at the end of their day to boot!v If you are looking for a Doggy Daycare or boarding place for your pup, you won't want to look any further than Walks and Wags. We are so very fortunate to have it here in Mobile!

name: diane gibbs
text: Amazing people and a great place to take your dog for exercise, socialization, and they work with the dogs. They have pools for the dogs, hit tennis balls endlessly and the dogs are ALWAYS supervised. There is no rough play allowed and they come home cleaned and ready to sleep! Dogs are worn out. They take a nap at the hottest part of the day and then back out to play! It is great!

Training with Alyne has been so fun! We have only just begun taking our new puppy to walks and wags. Alyne is kind and patient and we can’t wait to come back again and again!
Will be boarding and training with walks and wags often! :)

name: Gusto Frazier
text: The best place for a dog my lab wouldn't jump in or out my truck but after being with walks & wags she now jumps your dog will get all the fun and exercise it needs and also a bath I've also left my lab here for a weeks boarding when on family vacation they're the best they love dogs and dogs love them

name: Megan Blosser
text: Walks and Wags got my dog to come out of her shell.  When Reagan began doggie daycare at Walks and Wags, she was beyond anti-social with dogs outside of her home pack.  She would tuck her tail and run in the opposite direction of strange dogs.  We took her to Walks and Wags to socialize her.  The results are amazing!  Now Reagan is a total social butterfly.  Her tail is held high and wags happily.  Its like she was in a cocoon of shyness and now she is a content fluttering butterfly!

name: Lyn Lankford
text: Good service

name: Jessica Abbott

My husband and I love boarding our dogs here. One of our dogs got sick one night he was there and the owners spoon fed him some soft food. The next morning, they went back to the dogs an hour earlier to make sure he was okay. I am so grateful for the special care they gave that day. It won me over. I will always take our dogs to them because I trust them!
Also, if you take your dogs here for daycare or boarding, watch their Facebook page (Maddy's Pet Resort) for daily pictures of your pups! ❤️

name: David Mcdonald
text: She informed me without meeting my GSD that it would not do good in her boarding.

name: Michael Estrada

We love this place as much, if not more,  as our dog does.  It's like dropping him off at his "grandparents" and knowing they love him as much as we do.  Love the Facebook picture updates, too!  A nice touch and a great way to see our boy is having fun every day.
Highly recommended !!!

resp.text: Thank you, so much. Sultan entertains us as much as we do him. He is hilarious to watch and play with.

name: Tammie Stroud
text: I have boarded our dogs there twice in the last few years. They are very friendly and helpful and you can tell they care. When we had to leave them longer than a day they posted pictures of them on their Facebook page and we LOVED seeing them. We love our vet and have boarded them there however, Maddys IS a little resort for them and they have the freedom to go potty and they play with the other dogs. We always take our dogs when we can but if we HAVE to leave them we will always choose Maddy's.

The owners are awesome, personable people who clearly love their customers and their dogs! One time, Maddy's was booked (we waited until the last minute to call) and we had to take our dog to another local boarding facility. It was nothing like Maddy's and I worried about her the entire time. I would cancel a trip before boarding her anywhere else in the future. Love this place!

They are great at accommodating all my needs and never once have I worried when I dropped my dogs off for daycare or boarding if my animals needs were not being looked after.

resp.text: I would invite you, a person who has NEVER USED OUR BUSINESS, to call around and price places that offer as much outside play time as we do. Our guests get 6 to 7 hours of out of the room group playtime 4 days a week and up to 12 hours of group play time on daycare days, 3 days a week. Please get back with us when you find another. We are very competitively priced for boarding. One star rating based on one uninformed factor and opinion is unfair, rude and hurtful.

text:
LOVE!

We love the attention our dogs get, Barbara's sense of humor, and the entire operation.

name: Bama Bryant
text: We board our dogs 2-3 times a year for vacations or out of town matters. We usually board with 1 or 2 other places within the area. Decided to call & check prices at Maddy's to compare. We were told the whole spill about what our pets would get & how they'd be treated. It sounded decent until we told them we had 2 Dachshund & a Pitbull, then asked prices. The conversation quickly changed to "oh sorry we don't board those kinda dogs". Those kind of dogs we asked? "Yes Pitbulls" they replied. Instant red flag for me.  How are you gonna stereotype one breed of dog? A dog you've never met. A dog that lives with my 2yr old Son, 3yr old daughter & 2 wiener dogs inside. 2 potbelly pigs & about 30 chickens outside. Who goes to the dog park & has played with many other strange dogs. Who has been boarded atleast 25+ times in his 9yrs of age with no issues. My dogs are like my kids & for someone or someplace to stereotype or judge them on "Their Breed" is outrageous to me! I will never use your business & I will never refer anyone to your business either. Wish I could rate you zero stars! 1 star is to much for your business ranking in my opinion.

text: I'm a truck driver and our home vet is in North Carolina. We were coming through to deliver in Decatur and our Boxer was sick. We called when we were about 1hr away and they were able to fit us in to see the Vet and get him some meds. We want to say Thank You so much for helping us out.

name: Sarah Smith
text: I boarded my Yorkies with DAC, PC for a few days, all were well prior to boarding. Upon pick up and after arriving home all 3 were coughing constantly. I reported my Yorkies were experiencing coughing episodes, the vet was willing to evaluate 1 of my Yorkies and later advised me there was contact and exposure from another pet with with kennel cough at the clinic while my Yorkies were boarding. After paying boarding fees and Bordatella vaccine for each, I spent an additional $140.00 to treat my Yorkers for kennel cough. I was disappointed that the vet did not assume responsibility for the cost to treatment  given they were exposed and infected with kennel cough from another pet while being boarded at Decatur Animal Care. I will never board my pets there again and I do not recommend anyone boarding there fur babies due to how my case was managed and potential exposures.

name: L Cobl
text: Great friendly staff. They watch and baby my Rottweiler 4 days a week. She is always excited to go to "school."

Been going there 20 years
They know what to do

name: Teresa Smith
text: I've been using DAC for my dogs for several years now. Dr. Griffith and her staff have always been loving, respectful, and gentle.  They've treated my dogs with the same care they'd treat their own.  Dr. Griffith has had to help three of my dogs cross over the rainbow bridge, and I couldn't ask for a sweeter spirit be with us and to hug my boys and love on them as we were telling them goodbye.  Now I have a younger dog, and going to the Doggy Daycare at DAC has been the best thing in the world for him. He has a great time playing with other dogs that are similar in size and energy level, while I'm at work. If you're looking for a safe and fun place for your dog to spend the hours you're at work - look no further!  I love this clinic and the team that keeps it running. Great folks.

They take care of our cat, too. The people who work here are just exceptional people in every single way. They are awesome and friendly!

They love animals and that love is reflected in the warm compassionate hearts of every team member! Thank you for being the best veterinarian team in North Alabama!

RUDE!

text: I had to take my dog here to board her while I was in the hospital and I love Dr. Forrest !!! And when I came back to get her I could tell she had not been hit on. Unlike Dr. Cox where they were throwing a towel over her head and hitting her for biting at them. I'll use Dr. Forrest from now on he is very nice ! And when I got there he was closing and he waited on me to go home and get Baby and bring her back.

name: Shanda Whitten
text: Dr. Forrest was great when we took our dog there. He is very compassionate. The reason why I will not go back is because of the front desk lady. She is rude, condescending, and thinks it is ok to talk down to clients because they ask questions. We had a misunderstanding about how much it would cost, the quoted us almost 200.00 below what they actually charged us. One charge for my dogs nail trim while he was sedated before a procedure was almost 18.00.  She is the reason we will never step foot back in that clinic.

name: Brandon Arnett
text:
Let me begin by saying the Vet and his assistant were great. They were kind and compassionate and my short experience with them were wonderful. But the lady working the reception...by far the WORST encounter I have ever had.
I am not one to complain, I do not believe "the customer is always right" and I also understand sometimes you just catch people on a bad day, but even on my WORST day I have never treated another person the way this woman treated me.
Long story short, I took a dog in off the street, she turned out to be pregnant and had a litter of 10 puppies. At six weeks old I vaccinated them and de-wormed them, however one was failing to thrive. She quickly became ill and lethargic. I called to get an appointment to have her be seen. (My regular vet was absolute packed out due to the holiday weekend and suggested I call around to try to be seen as quickly as possible) I booked an appointment with Forrest Vet Clinic for later that day. However, the puppy quickly took a turn for the worst and so I rushed her in to be seen early. I knew enough to know it wasn't parvo (and it wasn't) but the dog was definitely suffering from something serious.

The receptionist greeted me with absolute contempt. While the dog convulsed and whimpered she stood there arguing that I never told her the dog was sick (of course I did but I was too polite to argue) she then curls her lip and says "you probably haven't even vaccinated it!" I explained I did and told her the brand used. She goes off on me. Rolled her eyes, told me I wasn't qualified, lectured me about how I had no clue to be buying some shot from a co-op (they were vet recommended and exceptionally reviewed vaccines by the way) all the mean while the dog is suffering terribly and shes too busy rolling her eyes at me to see anything is done about it.
Her terrible behavior continues until I feel about as big as an ant and like I am human garbage. You would of thought I was some back yard breeder who brought in a trash bag of starved puppies and dumped them in her cornflakes.
She continued to roll her eyes and curl her lip and snarl remarks at me until my sobbing 7 yr old whispers to me "mommy why is that lady making mean faces to you?" She announces loudly (but to no one because the place was all but empty) "that dog could have any contagious thing and we don't want it spreading it around. (understandably but come on, have some discreetness)
When the vet saw the pup he was incredibly kind about it, the tech was very compassionate and concerned for my nearly traumatized child who watched the pup convulse and die.
When it was all over I gathered what little nerves I had left and asked through humiliation and tears what the vet would charge to have the puppies de-wormed again at their office. The receptionist snarled yet again and said "Well I don't know. Who knows what you've given them and what you haven't and when!" and huffed at me.
I was tempted to take the remaining 9 (and exceptionally healthy and thriving pups) and dump them in her lap and ask her to so kindly home and feed and medicate and adopt out a group of rescue mutts in the middle of summer.
I was doing everything I could to keep this litter out of the humane society and it's been no easy financial or emotional task, but this cruel ladies absolute lack of compassion and decency had be more humiliated and disgusted then I have ever been. I had to pull over on the way home and just cry from the stress and humiliation of the entire experience.
I am not a breeder, these were rescues, I intend to ask no money for any of these precious puppies, and until I find them safe and loving homes I will be footing the bill for vaccines, food, etc. It's expensive and stressful but I am not some careless human garbage and never should of been spoken to as such.
So beware. It's a shame because the rest of the clinic seemed absolutely lovely, but I would crawl through hot sand and razor blades before I ever faced that woman at the desk again.

name: Heather Marie
text: I brought my cat in for a UTI, and they didn't run any tests. Now, I had to take my cat somewhere else to find out he is too sick. He was put to sleep yesterday all because proper tests weren't done. How is a vet not going to care about the animals also that come in? I wasted money in that office, just to have to go somewhere else! If they had done their job my Pepper would be at home sitting in his sunny spot on the back of the couch. I'm getting him back in a tiny pine box... He was only a year old.

name: Dawn Donald
text: knowledgeable, courteous, and very helpful. I also recommend their boarding service.

name: Barry Holmes
text: I was very nervous about having my older poodle's teeth cleaned because of bad experiences in the past. Dr. Forrest was very reassuring and kept me informed about his progress.  They used gas instead of anesthesia with a shot, which meant that the effects were gone as soon as the gas was removed.

name: Jennifer Thomas
text: The lady answering the phones when i called checking pricing on fixing a small dog that we are thinking about getting was a very rude person and when i commented on the price (not wanting to be ugly and with the consideration that it has been about 11 years the last time i needed this service) she was very hateful and hung up on me.  I called back and asked for the office manager and was told she was her when i asked to speak to the owner i was told that he was with a client and i left a number and name and when  she asked me what it was in refrence to i told her a pet and and she responded that he would not call me back if i was not a client.  all i could say was WOW.  if they will treat the owner like this you might want to rethink taking your pet because your pet can not let you know that they have been mistreated.

name: J Culp
text: BEWARE!!! If I could give a negative star, I would...I have NEVER been treated so rudely as I was by Cindy at Dr. Forrest's office...my animals are always seen by Dr. Cox...Dr. Cox's office is ran professionally and courteously...my daughter took her sick puppy with parvo to Dr. Forrest...only because Dr. Cox was not in his office that afternoon...I sent a check with the puppy for Dr. Cox's office which ended up at Dr. Forrest's by accident...I was instructed that she, Cindy, had marked out Dr. Cox's name and added Dr. Forrest...in case she doesn't know, that is FRAUDULENT and punishable by law...I would NEVER take an animal to this office...not even a dead buzzard...SMH :-(
